items.sentence: I know you could do that if you would only try.
You can't be too careful when choosing friends.
I found the book which I'd lost the day before.
I read the book after I'd finished my homework.
I went to church every Sunday when I was a boy.
I asked the villagers many times to let me die.
I stayed up late preparing for the examination.
I like to have my dictionary within easy reach.
I have lots of work to clear up by the weekend.
I caught on to what the teacher was explaining.
I read the most interesting book in my library.
I have been in the hospital for the last month.
I want this luggage carried to my room at once.
I have almost no information about the problem.
I ran as fast as I could, but I missed the bus.
I believe that everyone will like this picture.
I spent the summer vacation at my aunt's house.
I heard about it from another source last year.
I don't like the idea that money is everything.
I came upon an old friend of mine on the train.
I have the same dictionary as your brother has.
I only asked you the question out of curiosity.
I spoke to the boy who seemed to be the oldest.
I went to the boss in hopes of getting a raise.
I make it a rule to brush my teeth after meals.
I reached the museum after a few minutes' walk.
I saw a man standing naked under the waterfall.
I suffer from depression during the wintertime.
I take it for granted that they'll get married.
I found my mother busy ironing out some shirts.
I tried my best to get them to stop quarreling.
I don't think that an exception should be made.
I'd read only a few pages before I fell asleep.
I got tired of hearing the same thing so often.
I don't like my father's attending the meeting.
I have a large number of books on my bookshelf.
I have no idea how to do deal with my daughter.
It's true that she's pretty, but she's selfish.
Tom loved Mary, but she didn\'t like him at all.
I don\'t really understand what you want to say.
I don\'t see any reason why I have to apologize.
I don\'t think Tom and Mary have much in common.
I don\'t want Tom to think he has to protect me.
I don\'t want an apology. I want an explanation.
I don\'t want to go out in this kind of weather.
Did you hear about Tom\'s plans for the weekend?
Don\'t forget to return the book to the library.
Don\'t hesitate to tell me if you need anything.
Tom couldn\'t persuade Mary to accept the money.
Tom didn\'t know whether to believe Mary or not.
Tom didn\'t notice the bullet holes in the wall.
Tom didn\'t want Mary to go out with other guys.
Let\'s dine out tonight. I\'m too tired to cook.
Tom is one of Boston\'s most successful lawyers.
Are you going to do your homework before dinner?
Are you going to tell Tom to leave, or should I?
Are you planning on eating that all by yourself?
Tom wasn\'t as busy as Mary told me he would be.
We\'re getting out of here. The cops are coming.
Neither my wife nor my children knew about that.
New York City policemen wear dark blue uniforms.
Our situation should improve in the near future.
Preparations for the party were nearly complete.
Sometimes we need to take a step back and think.
Sorry, I forgot to tell you something important.
Tom has been teaching me how to play the guitar.
Tom is from Boston, but now he lives in Chicago.
I always thought Tom and Mary would get married.
I anticipated a quiet vacation in the mountains.
I appreciate you seeing me on such short notice.
I arranged for a car to meet you at the airport.
I arrived in Boston at 2:30 yesterday afternoon.
Isn\'t it possible Tom was the one who did this?
It won\'t be possible for us to meet your needs.
Why don\'t you polish the shoes with this cloth?

Why don\'t you start by telling us what you saw?
Why don\'t you stop over at my place on the way?
Why don\'t you stop worrying and get some sleep?
Tickets are still available for tonight\'s show.
Tom acts like he doesn\'t even know who Mary is.
Tom added both his and Mary\'s name to the list.
This isn\'t my umbrella; it\'s somebody else\'s.
